      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<span class="line"><!---->This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<!----></span><br><br>The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<span class="line"><!---->The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<!----></span><br><br>1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is >= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<span class="line"><!---->1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is &gt;= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<!----></span><br><br>2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ <- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<span class="line"><!---->2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ &lt;- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<!----></span><br><br>Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Overflow 1: <span class="line"><!---->Overflow 1: <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const N = 256*1024*1024;<span class="line"><!---->const N = 256*1024*1024;<!----></span><br>let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<span class="line"><!---->let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<!----></span><br>largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<!----></span><br>const arr = [];<span class="line"><!---->const arr = [];<!----></span><br>while (arr.length * N < 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->while (arr.length * N &lt; 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<!----></span><br><br>console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<span class="line"><!---->console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Overflow 2:<span class="line"><!---->Overflow 2:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: tab<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>They basically have the same backtrace:<span class="line"><!---->They basically have the same backtrace:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(gdb) bt<span class="line"><!---->(gdb) bt<!----></span><br>#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<span class="line"><!---->#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<!----></span><br>#1           Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1468456#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<a id="user-link" href="/u/3848737955" title="kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me"><!---->kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<!----></a>
      kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Sun, Jul 30, 2023, 11:37 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jul 30, 2023, 11:37 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1468456#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jul 30, 2023, 11:37 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1468456#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jul 30, 2023, 11:37 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<span class="line"><!---->While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<span class="line"><!---->const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<!----></span><br>const a = new Array(256).fill(s);<span class="line"><!---->const a = new Array(256).fill(s);<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(a);<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(a);<!----></span><br>/* ^ throws before patch, fails with CHECK after<span class="line"><!---->/* ^ throws before patch, fails with CHECK after<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in , line 0<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in , line 0<!----></span><br># Check failed: (location_) != nullptr.<span class="line"><!----># Check failed: (location_) != nullptr.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span         I don't think the fix in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think the fix in <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a> is sufficient for the issue in <span class="line"><!----> is sufficient for the issue in <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<span class="line"><!---->void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<!----></span><br> kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<span class="line"><!---->  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ > String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<span class="line"><!---->overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ cat json-check-fail.js<span         > currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<span class="line"><!---->&gt; currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<!----></span><br><br>The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal<String> when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal&lt;String&gt; when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br><br>As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<span class="line"><!---->As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I don't think this is fully fixed. The second issue in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think this is fully fixed. The second issue in <!----></span>#c1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c1"><!---->#c1<!----></a> no longer has an integer overflow but it now infinite loops:<span class="line"><!----> no longer has an integer overflow but it now infinite loops:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The other issues look fine now.<span class="line"><!---->The other issues look fine now.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1468456%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D0" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1468456%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D0%252526ust%25253D1703397305155375%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw0gpqrkrQDEueovFubVyaGc%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>

                  <!---->:
                </span>

              <!---->
            </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        Description #1 by kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me (Jul 28, 2023)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<span class="line"><!---->This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<!----></span><br><br>The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<span class="line"><!---->The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<!----></span><br><br>1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is >= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<span class="line"><!---->1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is &gt;= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<!----></span><br><br>2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ <- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<span class="line"><!---->2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ &lt;- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<!----></span><br><br>Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Overflow 1: <span class="line"><!---->Overflow 1: <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const N = 256*1024*1024;<span class="line"><!---->const N = 256*1024*1024;<!----></span><br>let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<span class="line"><!---->let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<!----></span><br>largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<!----></span><br>const arr = [];<span class="line"><!---->const arr = [];<!----></span><br>while (arr.length * N < 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->while (arr.length * N &lt; 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<!----></span><br><br>console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<span class="line"><!---->console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Overflow 2:<span class="line"><!---->Overflow 2:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: tab<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>They basically have the same backtrace:<span class="line"><!---->They basically have the same backtrace:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(gdb) bt<span class="line"><!---->(gdb) bt<!----></span><br>#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<span class="line"><!---->#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<!----></span><br>#1  __pthread_kill_internal (signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:78<span class="line"><!---->#1  __pthread_kill_internal (signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:78<!----></span><br>#2  __GI___pthread_kill (threadid=140737352652736, signo=signo@entry=6) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:89<span class="line"><!---->#2  __GI___pthread_kill (threadid=140737352652736, signo=signo@entry=6) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:89<!----></span><br>#3  0x00007ffff7c42476 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26<span class="line"><!---->#3  0x00007ffff7c42476 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26<!----></span><br>#4  0x00007ffff7c287f3 in __GI_abort () at ./stdlib/abort.c:79<span class="line"><!---->#4  0x00007ffff7c287f3 in __GI_abort () at ./stdlib/abort.c:79<!----></span><br>#5  0x000055555734b1e6 in std::__terminate(void (*)()) ()<span class="line"><!---->#5  0x000055555734b1e6 in std::__terminate(void (*)()) ()<!----></span><br>#6  0x000055555734aeeb in __cxxabiv1::failed_throw(__cxxabiv1::__cxa_exception*) ()<span class="line"><!---->#6  0x000055555734aeeb in __cxxabiv1::failed_throw(__cxxabiv1::__cxa_exception*) ()<!----></span><br>#7  0x000055555734ae64 in __cxa_throw ()<span class="line"><!---->#7  0x000055555734ae64 in __cxa_throw ()<!----></span><br>#8  0x000055555734aa3d in operator new(unsigned long) ()<span class="line"><!---->#8  0x000055555734aa3d in operator new(unsigned long) ()<!----></span><br>#9  0x00005555565d7c3b in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Extend() ()<span class="line"><!---->#9  0x00005555565d7c3b in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Extend() ()<!----></span><br>#10 0x00005555565d98ab in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::AppendString(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::String>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#10 0x00005555565d98ab in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::AppendString(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::String&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#11 0x00005555565d8183 in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Result v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Serialize_<false>(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, bool, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#11 0x00005555565d8183 in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Result v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Serialize_&lt;false&gt;(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, bool, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#12 0x00005555565d211c in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Stringify(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#12 0x00005555565d211c in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Stringify(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;,         While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<span class="line"><!---->While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<span         I don't think the fix in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think the fix in <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a> is sufficient for the issue in <span class="line"><!----> is sufficient for the issue in <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<span class="line"><!---->void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<!----></span><br>  if (part_length_ >= String::kMaxLength) overflowed_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  if (part_length_ &gt;= String::kMaxLength) overflowed_ = true;<!----></span><br>  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<span class="line"><!---->  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ > String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<span class="line"><!---->overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ &gt; String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ cat json-check-fail.js<span class="line"><!---->$ cat json-check-fail.js<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(['a'.repeat(%StringMaxLength() - 1)])<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(['a'.repeat(%StringMaxLength() - 1)])<!----></span><br>$ out/x64.release/d8 --allow-natives-syntax json-check-fail.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/x64.release/d8 --allow-natives-syntax           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1468456#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 3, 2023, 3:11 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>

        > currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<span class="line"><!---->&gt; currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<!----></span><br><br>The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal<String> when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal&lt;String&gt; when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br><br>As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<span class="line"><!---->As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for your explanation!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your explanation!<!----></span><br>The CHECK in ToHandleChecked() can't throw invalid string length exception, I added logic before constructing String for throw exception when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK in ToHandleChecked() can't throw invalid string length exception, I added logic before constructing String for throw exception when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br>Use base::OneByteVector(str, length) to avoid the strlen is great idea, I followed your idea, thanks.<span class="line"><!---->Use base::OneByteVector(str, length) to avoid the strlen is great idea, I followed your idea, thanks.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {

            width: 100%;

            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<span class="line"><!---->This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<!----></span><br><br>The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<span class="line"><!---->The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<!----></span><br><br>1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is >= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<span class="line"><!---->1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is &gt;= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<!----></span><br><br>2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ <- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<span class="line"><!---->2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ &lt;- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<!----></span><br><br>Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Overflow 1: <span class="line"><!---->Overflow 1: <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const N = 256*1024*1024;<span class="line"><!---->const N = 256*1024*1024;<!----></span><br>let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<span class="line"><!---->let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<!----></span><br>largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<!----></span><br>const arr = [];<span class="line"><!---->const arr = [];<!----></span><br>while (arr.length * N < 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->while (arr.length * N &lt; 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<!----></span><br><br>console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<span class="line"><!---->console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Overflow 2:<span class="line"><!---->Overflow 2:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: tab<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>They basically have the same backtrace:<span class="line"><!---->They basically have the same backtrace:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(gdb) bt<span class="line"><!---->(gdb) bt<!----></span><br>#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<span class="line"><!---->#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<!----></span><br>#1  __pthread_kill_internal (signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:78<span class="line"><!---->#1  __pthread_kill_internal (signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:78<!----></span><br>#2  __GI___pthread_kill (threadid=140737352652736, signo=signo@entry=6) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:89<span class="line"><!---->#2  __GI___pthread_kill (threadid=140737352652736, signo=signo@entry=6) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:89<!----></span><br>#3  0x00007ffff7c42476 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26<span class="line"><!---->#3  0x00007ffff7c42476 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26<!----></span><br>#4  0x00007ffff7c287f3 in __GI_abort () at ./stdlib/abort.c:79<span class="line"><!---->#4  0x00007ffff7c287f3 in __GI_abort () at ./stdlib/abort.c:79<!----></span><br>#5  0x000055555734b1e6 in std::__terminate(void (*)()) ()<span class="line"><!---->#5  0x000055555734b1e6 in std::__terminate(void (*)()) ()<!----></span><br>#6  0x000055555734aeeb in __cxxabiv1::failed_throw(__cxxabiv1::__cxa_exception*) ()<span class="line"><!---->#6  0x000055555734aeeb in __cxxabiv1::failed_throw(__cxxabiv1::__cxa_exception*) ()<!----></span><br>#7  0x000055555734ae64 in __cxa_throw ()<span class="line"><!---->#7  0x000055555734ae64 in __cxa_throw ()<!----></span><br>#8  0x000055555734aa3d in operator new(unsigned long) ()<span class="line"><!---->#8  0x000055555734aa3d in operator new(unsigned long) ()<!----></span><br>#9  0x00005555565d7c3b in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Extend() ()<span class="line"><!---->#9  0x00005555565d7c3b in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Extend() ()<!----></span><br>#10 0x00005555565d98ab in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::AppendString(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::String>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#10 0x00005555565d98ab in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::AppendString(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::String&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#11 0x00005555565d8183 in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Result v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Serialize_<false>(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, bool, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#11 0x00005555565d8183 in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Result v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Serialize_&lt;false&gt;(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, bool, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#12 0x00005555565d211c in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Stringify(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#12 0x00005555565d211c in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Stringify(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#13 0x00005555565d200b in v8::internal::JsonStringify(v8::internal::Isolate*, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#13 0x00005555565d200b in v8::internal::JsonStringify(v8::internal::Isolate*, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#14 0x00005555562d0865 in v8::internal::Builtin_JsonStringify(int, unsigned long*, v8::internal::Isolate*) ()<span class="line"><!---->#14 0x00005555562d0865 in v8::internal::Builtin_JsonStringify(int, unsigned long*, v8::internal::Isolate*) ()<!----></span><br>#15 0x0000555557203d76 in Builtins_CEntry_Return1_ArgvOnStack_BuiltinExit ()<span class="line"><!---->#15 0x0000555557203d76 in Builtins_CEntry_Return1_ArgvOnStack_BuiltinExit ()<!----></span><br>#16 0x000055555716cda4 in Builtins_InterpreterEntryTrampoline ()<span class="line"><!---->#16 0x000055555716cda4 in Builtins_InterpreterEntryTrampoline ()<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Keyhan Vakil<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Keyhan Vakil<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<span class="line"><!---->While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<span class="line"><!---->const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<!----></span><br>const a = new Array(256).fill(s);<span class="line"><!---->const a = new Array(256).fill(s);<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(a);<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(a);<!----></span><br>/* ^ throws before patch, fails with CHECK after<span class="line"><!---->/* ^         I don't think the fix in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think the fix in <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a> is sufficient for the issue in <span class="line"><!----> is sufficient for the issue in <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<span class="line"><!---->void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<!----></span><br>  if (part_length_ >= String::kMaxLength) overflowed_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  if (part_length_ &gt;= String::kMaxLength) overflowed_ = true;<!----></span><br>  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<span class="line"><!---->  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ > String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<span class="line"><!---->overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ &gt; String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ cat json-check-fail.js<span           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1468456#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 3, 2023, 3:11 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>

        > currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<span class="line"><!---->&gt; currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<!----></span><br><br>The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal<String> when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal&lt;String&gt; when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br><br>As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<span class="line"><!---->As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for your explanation!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your explanation!<!----></span><br>The CHECK in ToHandleChecked() can't throw invalid string length exception, I added logic before constructing String for throw exception when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK in ToHandleChecked() can't throw invalid string length exception, I added logic before constructing String for throw exception when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br>Use base::OneByteVector(str, length) to avoid the strlen is great idea, I followed your idea, thanks.<span class="line"><!---->Use base::OneByteVector(str, length) to avoid the strlen is great idea, I followed your idea, thanks.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;

          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me (Jul 28, 2023)

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me (Jul 28, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
