      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<span class="line"><!---->This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<!----></span><br><br>The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<span class="line"><!---->The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<!----></span><br><br>1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is >= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<span class="line"><!---->1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is &gt;= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<!----></span><br><br>2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ <- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<span class="line"><!---->2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ &lt;- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<!----></span><br><br>Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Overflow 1: <span class="line"><!---->Overflow 1: <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const N = 256*1024*1024;<span class="line"><!---->const N = 256*1024*1024;<!----></span><br>let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<span class="line"><!---->let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<!----></span><br>largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<!----></span><br>const arr = [];<span class="line"><!---->const arr = [];<!----></span><br>while (arr.length * N < 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->while (arr.length * N &lt; 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<!----></span><br><br>console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<span class="line"><!---->console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Overflow 2:<span class="line"><!---->Overflow 2:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: tab<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>They basically have the same backtrace:<span class="line"><!---->They basically have the same backtrace:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(gdb) bt<span class="line"><!---->(gdb) bt<!----></span><br>#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<span class="line"><!---->#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<!----></span><br>#1  __pthread_kill_internal (signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:78<span class="line"><!---->#1  __pthread_kill_internal (signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:78<!----></span><br>#2  __GI___pthread_kill (threadid=140737352652736, signo=signo@entry=6) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:89<span class="line"><!---->#2  __GI___pthread_kill (threadid=140737352652736, signo=signo@entry=6) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:89<!----></span><br>#3  0x00007ffff7c42476 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26<span class="line"><!---->#3  0x00007ffff7c42476 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26<!----></span><br>#4  0x00007ffff7c287f3 in __GI_abort () at ./stdlib/abort.c:79<span class="line"><!---->#4  0x00007ffff7c287f3 in __GI_abort () at ./stdlib/abort.c:79<!----></span><br>#5  0x000055555734b1e6 in std::__terminate(void (*)()) ()<span class="line"><!---->#5 ()<!----></span><br>#8  0x000055555734aa3d in operator new(unsigned long) ()<span class="line"><!---->#8  0x000055555734aa3d in operator new(unsigned long) ()<!----></span><br>#9  0x00005555565d7c3b in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Extend() ()<span class="line"><!---->#9  0x00005555565d7c3b in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Extend() ()<!----></span><br>#10 0x00005555565d98ab in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::AppendString(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::String>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#10 0x00005555565d98ab in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::AppendString(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::String&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#11 0x00005555565d8183 in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Result v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Serialize_<false>(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, bool, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#11 0x00005555565d8183 in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Result v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Serialize_&lt;false&gt;(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, bool, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#12 0x00005555565d211c in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Stringify(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#12 0x00005555565d211c in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Stringify(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#13 0x00005555565d200b in v8::internal::JsonStringify(v8::internal::Isolate*, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#13 0x00005555565d200b in v8::internal::JsonStringify(v8::internal::Isolate*, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#14 0x00005555562d0865 in v8::internal::Builtin_JsonStringify(int, unsigned long*, v8::internal::Isolate*) ()<span class="line"><!---->#14 0x00005555562d0865 in v8::internal::Builtin_JsonStringify(int, unsigned long*, v8::internal::Isolate*) ()<!----></span><br>#15 0x0000555557203d76 in Builtins_CEntry_Return1_ArgvOnStack_BuiltinExit ()<span class="line"><!---->#15 0x0000555557203d76 in Builtins_CEntry_Return1_ArgvOnStack_BuiltinExit ()<!----></span><br>#16 0x000055555716cda4 in Builtins_InterpreterEntryTrampoline ()<span class="line"><!---->#16 0x000055555716cda4 in Builtins_InterpreterEntryTrampoline ()<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes.           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1468456#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jul 30, 2023, 11:37 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<span class="line"><!---->While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<span         I don't think the fix in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think the fix in <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a> is sufficient for the issue in <span class="line"><!----> is sufficient for the issue in <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<span class="line"><!---->void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<!----></span><br> kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<span class="line"><!---->  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ > String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<span class="line"><!---->overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ &gt; String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ cat json-check-fail.js<span         > currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<span class="line"><!---->&gt; currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<!----></span><br><br>The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal<String> when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal&lt;String&gt; when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br><br>As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<span class="line"><!---->As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I don't think this is fully fixed. The second issue in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think this is fully fixed. The second issue in <!----></span>#c1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c1"><!---->#c1<!----></a> no longer has an integer overflow but it now infinite loops:<span class="line"><!----> no longer has an integer overflow but it now infinite loops:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The other issues look fine now.<span class="line"><!---->The other issues look fine now.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1468456: Security: signed integer overflow in new JSON.stringify
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1468456: Security: signed integer overflow in new JSON.stringify
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<a id="user-link" href="/u/3848737955" title="kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me"><!---->kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<!----></a>
      kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>

        Description #1 by kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me (Jul 28, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me (Jul 28, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me (Jul 28, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me (Jul 28, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<span class="line"><!---->This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<!----></span><br><br>The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<span class="line"><!---->The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<!----></span><br><br>1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is >= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<span class="line"><!---->1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is &gt;= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<!----></span><br><br>2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ <- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<span class="line"><!---->2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ &lt;- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<!----></span><br><br>Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Overflow 1: <span class="line"><!---->Overflow 1: <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const N = 256*1024*1024;<span class="line"><!---->const N = 256*1024*1024;<!----></span><br>let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<span class="line"><!---->let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<!----></span><br>largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<!----></span><br>const arr = [];<span class="line"><!---->const arr = [];<!----></span><br>while (arr.length * N < 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->while (arr.length * N &lt; 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<!----></span><br><br>console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<span class="line"><!---->console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Overflow 2:<span class="line"><!---->Overflow 2:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: tab<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>They basically have the same backtrace:<span class="line"><!---->They basically have the same backtrace:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(gdb) bt<span class="line"><!---->(gdb) bt<!----></span><br>#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at         by

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<span class="line"><!---->While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<span class="line"><!---->const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<!----></span><br>const a = new Array(256).fill(s);<span class="line"><!---->const a = new Array(256).fill(s);<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(a);<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(a);<!----></span><br>/* ^ throws before patch, fails with CHECK after<span class="line"><!---->/* ^ throws before patch, fails with CHECK after<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in , line 0<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in , line 0<!----></span><br># Check failed: (location_) != nullptr.<span class="line"><!----># Check failed: (location_) != nullptr.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#FailureMessage Object: 0x7fffa3d947b0<span class="line"><!---->#FailureMessage Object:         I don't think the fix in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think the fix in <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a> is sufficient for the issue in <span class="line"><!----> is sufficient for the issue in <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<span class="line"><!---->void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<!----></span><br>  if (part_length_ >= String::kMaxLength) overflowed_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  if (part_length_ &gt;= String::kMaxLength) overflowed_ = true;<!----></span><br>  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<span class="line"><!---->  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ > String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<span class="line"><!---->overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ &gt; String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ cat json-check-fail.js<span class="line"><!---->$ cat json-check-fail.js<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(['a'.repeat(%StringMaxLength() - 1)])<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(['a'.repeat(%StringMaxLength() - 1)])<!----></span><br>$ out/x64.release/d8 --allow-natives-syntax json-check-fail.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/x64.release/d8 --allow-natives-syntax       </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<span class="line"><!---->&gt; currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<!----></span><br><br>The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal<String> when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal&lt;String&gt; when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br><br>As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<span class="line"><!---->As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<span class="line"><!---->This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<!----></span><br><br>The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<span class="line"><!---->The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<!----></span><br><br>1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is >= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<span class="line"><!---->1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is &gt;= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<!----></span><br><br>2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ <- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<span class="line"><!---->2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ &lt;- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<!----></span><br><br>Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Overflow 1: <span class="line"><!---->Overflow 1: <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const N = 256*1024*1024;<span class="line"><!---->const N = 256*1024*1024;<!----></span><br>let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<span class="line"><!---->let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<!----></span><br>largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<!----></span><br>const arr = [];<span class="line"><!---->const arr = [];<!----></span><br>while (arr.length * N < 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->while (arr.length * N &lt; 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<!----></span><br><br>console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<span class="line"><!---->console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Overflow 2:<span class="line"><!---->Overflow 2:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: tab<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>They basically have the same backtrace:<span class="line"><!---->They basically have the same backtrace:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(gdb) bt<span class="line"><!---->(gdb) bt<!----></span><br>#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<span class="line"><!---->#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<!----></span><br>#1           Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1468456#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<a id="user-link" href="/u/3848737955" title="kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me"><!---->kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<!----></a>
      kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Sun, Jul 30, 2023, 11:37 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jul 30, 2023, 11:37 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1468456#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jul 30, 2023, 11:37 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1468456#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jul 30, 2023, 11:37 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<span class="line"><!---->While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<span class="line"><!---->const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<!----></span><br>const a = new Array(256).fill(s);<span class="line"><!---->const a = new Array(256).fill(s);<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(a);<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(a);<!----></span><br>/* ^ throws before patch, fails with CHECK after<span class="line"><!---->/* ^ throws before patch, fails with CHECK after<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in , line 0<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in , line 0<!----></span><br># Check failed: (location_) != nullptr.<span class="line"><!----># Check failed: (location_) != nullptr.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span         I don't think the fix in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think the fix in <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a> is sufficient for the issue in <span class="line"><!----> is sufficient for the issue in <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<span class="line"><!---->void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<!----></span><br> kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<span class="line"><!---->  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ > String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<span class="line"><!---->overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ cat json-check-fail.js<span         > currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<span class="line"><!---->&gt; currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<!----></span><br><br>The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal<String> when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal&lt;String&gt; when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br><br>As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<span class="line"><!---->As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I don't think this is fully fixed. The second issue in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think this is fully fixed. The second issue in <!----></span>#c1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c1"><!---->#c1<!----></a> no longer has an integer overflow but it now infinite loops:<span class="line"><!----> no longer has an integer overflow but it now infinite loops:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The other issues look fine now.<span class="line"><!---->The other issues look fine now.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<span class="line"><!---->This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<!----></span><br><br>The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<span class="line"><!---->The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<!----></span><br><br>1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is >= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<span class="line"><!---->1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is &gt;= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<!----></span><br><br>2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ <- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<span class="line"><!---->2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ &lt;- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<!----></span><br><br>Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Overflow 1: <span class="line"><!---->Overflow 1: <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const N = 256*1024*1024;<span class="line"><!---->const N = 256*1024*1024;<!----></span><br>let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<span class="line"><!---->let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<!----></span><br>largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<!----></span><br>const arr = [];<span class="line"><!---->const arr = [];<!----></span><br>while (arr.length * N < 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->while (arr.length * N &lt; 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<!----></span><br><br>console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<span class="line"><!---->console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Overflow 2:<span class="line"><!---->Overflow 2:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: tab<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>They basically have the same backtrace:<span class="line"><!---->They basically have the same backtrace:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(gdb) bt<span class="line"><!---->(gdb) bt<!----></span><br>#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<span class="line"><!---->#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<!----></span><br>#1  __pthread_kill_internal (signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:78<span class="line"><!---->#1  __pthread_kill_internal (signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:78<!----></span><br>#2  __GI___pthread_kill (threadid=140737352652736, signo=signo@entry=6) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:89<span class="line"><!---->#2  __GI___pthread_kill (threadid=140737352652736, signo=signo@entry=6) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:89<!----></span><br>#3  0x00007ffff7c42476 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26<span class="line"><!---->#3  0x00007ffff7c42476 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26<!----></span><br>#4  0x00007ffff7c287f3 in __GI_abort () at ./stdlib/abort.c:79<span class="line"><!---->#4  0x00007ffff7c287f3 in __GI_abort () at ./stdlib/abort.c:79<!----></span><br>#5  0x000055555734b1e6 in std::__terminate(void (*)()) ()<span class="line"><!---->#5  0x000055555734b1e6 in std::__terminate(void (*)()) ()<!----></span><br>#6  0x000055555734aeeb in __cxxabiv1::failed_throw(__cxxabiv1::__cxa_exception*) ()<span class="line"><!---->#6         While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<span class="line"><!---->While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<span         I don't think the fix in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think the fix in <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a> is sufficient for the issue in <span class="line"><!----> is sufficient for the issue in <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<span class="line"><!---->void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<!----></span><br>  if (part_length_ >= String::kMaxLength) overflowed_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  if (part_length_ &gt;= String::kMaxLength) overflowed_ = true;<!----></span><br>  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<span class="line"><!---->  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ > String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<span class="line"><!---->overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ &gt; String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ cat json-check-fail.js<span         > currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<span class="line"><!---->&gt; currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<!----></span><br><br>The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal<String> when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal&lt;String&gt; when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br><br>As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<span class="line"><!---->As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for your explanation!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your explanation!<!----></span><br>The CHECK in ToHandleChecked() can't throw invalid string length exception, I added logic before constructing String for throw exception when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK in ToHandleChecked() can't throw invalid string length exception, I added logic before constructing String for throw exception when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br>Use base::OneByteVector(str, length) to avoid the strlen is great idea, I followed your idea, thanks.<span class="line"><!---->Use base::OneByteVector(str, length) to avoid the strlen is great idea, I followed your idea, thanks.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me (Jul 28, 2023)

        Description #1 by kva...@googlecontrib.kvakil.me (Jul 28, 2023)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<span class="line"><!---->This may be known already, I see some similar fixes going into trunk. But these are still unfixed so I thought I'd report it just in case.<!----></span><br><br>The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<span class="line"><!---->The new JSON stringifier can overflow part_length_ in a couple of ways:<!----></span><br><br>1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is >= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<span class="line"><!---->1. if the combined length of all JSON strings is &gt;= 2**31, it'll overflow the signed int part_length_ in Extend. In practice this just seems to crash when `new` is invoked with a negative number.<!----></span><br><br>2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ <- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<span class="line"><!---->2. if a rawJSON with a two-byte is passed into the stringifier which has not yet set encoding_ &lt;- TWO_BYTE_ENCODING, CanAppendByCopy will always return false. This means that Extend will be called repeatedly in AppendString which causes the overflow to occur much faster.<!----></span><br><br>Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies if these issues are already found by the fuzzers, seems likely.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 117.0.5911.2 / dev<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Overflow 1: <span class="line"><!---->Overflow 1: <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const N = 256*1024*1024;<span class="line"><!---->const N = 256*1024*1024;<!----></span><br>let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<span class="line"><!---->let largeString = 'a'.repeat(N);<!----></span><br>largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->largeString = %FlattenString(largeString);<!----></span><br>const arr = [];<span class="line"><!---->const arr = [];<!----></span><br>while (arr.length * N < 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<span class="line"><!---->while (arr.length * N &lt; 2**32) arr.push(largeString);<!----></span><br><br>console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<span class="line"><!---->console.log(JSON.stringify(arr).length);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Overflow 2:<span class="line"><!---->Overflow 2:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<span class="line"><!---->const a = `"${'\u1234'.repeat(128)}"`;<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(JSON.rawJSON(a))<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: tab<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: tab<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>They basically have the same backtrace:<span class="line"><!---->They basically have the same backtrace:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(gdb) bt<span class="line"><!---->(gdb) bt<!----></span><br>#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<span class="line"><!---->#0  __pthread_kill_implementation (no_tid=0, signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:44<!----></span><br>#1  __pthread_kill_internal (signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:78<span class="line"><!---->#1  __pthread_kill_internal (signo=6, threadid=140737352652736) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:78<!----></span><br>#2  __GI___pthread_kill (threadid=140737352652736, signo=signo@entry=6) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:89<span class="line"><!---->#2  __GI___pthread_kill (threadid=140737352652736, signo=signo@entry=6) at ./nptl/pthread_kill.c:89<!----></span><br>#3  0x00007ffff7c42476 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26<span class="line"><!---->#3  0x00007ffff7c42476 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/posix/raise.c:26<!----></span><br>#4  0x00007ffff7c287f3 in __GI_abort () at ./stdlib/abort.c:79<span class="line"><!---->#4  0x00007ffff7c287f3 in __GI_abort () at ./stdlib/abort.c:79<!----></span><br>#5  0x000055555734b1e6 in std::__terminate(void (*)()) ()<span class="line"><!---->#5 ()<!----></span><br>#8  0x000055555734aa3d in operator new(unsigned long) ()<span class="line"><!---->#8  0x000055555734aa3d in operator new(unsigned long) ()<!----></span><br>#9  0x00005555565d7c3b in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Extend() ()<span class="line"><!---->#9  0x00005555565d7c3b in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Extend() ()<!----></span><br>#10 0x00005555565d98ab in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::AppendString(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::String>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#10 0x00005555565d98ab in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::AppendString(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::String&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#11 0x00005555565d8183 in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Result v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Serialize_<false>(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, bool, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#11 0x00005555565d8183 in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Result v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Serialize_&lt;false&gt;(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, bool, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#12 0x00005555565d211c in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Stringify(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#12 0x00005555565d211c in v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Stringify(v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) ()<span class="line"><!---->#13 0x00005555565d200b in v8::internal::JsonStringify(v8::internal::Isolate*, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;, v8::internal::Handle&lt;v8::internal::Object&gt;) ()<!----></span><br>#14 0x00005555562d0865 in v8::internal::Builtin_JsonStringify(int, unsigned long*, v8::internal::Isolate*) ()<span class="line"><!---->#14 0x00005555562d0865 in v8::internal::Builtin_JsonStringify(int, unsigned long*, v8::internal::Isolate*) ()<!----></span><br>#15 0x0000555557203d76 in Builtins_CEntry_Return1_ArgvOnStack_BuiltinExit ()<span class="line"><!---->#15 0x0000555557203d76 in Builtins_CEntry_Return1_ArgvOnStack_BuiltinExit ()<!----></span><br>#16 0x000055555716cda4 in Builtins_InterpreterEntryTrampoline ()<span class="line"><!---->#16 0x000055555716cda4 in Builtins_InterpreterEntryTrampoline ()<!----></span><br>```<span         While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<span class="line"><!---->While we're talking about RangeError, another regression is that the new code uses NewAsciiFromChecked when encoding_ == ONE_BYTE_ENCODING. That crashes if the string is too big, unlike the previous behavior of throwing an exception. Probably it would be better to use NewStringFromOneByte instead.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>const s = 'A'.repeat(2*1024*1024);<span         I don't think the fix in <span class="line"><!---->I don't think the fix in <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a> is sufficient for the issue in <span class="line"><!----> is sufficient for the issue in <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<span class="line"><!---->void JsonStringifier::Extend() {<!----></span><br>  if (part_length_ >= String::kMaxLength) overflowed_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  if (part_length_ &gt;= String::kMaxLength) overflowed_ = true;<!----></span><br>  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<span class="line"><!---->  part_length_ *= kPartLengthGrowthFactor;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ > String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<span class="line"><!---->overflowed_ is only set when part_length_ exceeds String::kMaxLength at the beginning of the call to JsonStringifier::Extend, that doesn't stop current_index_ from exceeding v8::String::kMaxLength: you can have part_length_ &gt; String::kMaxLength _after_ the multiplication and so current_index_ can be greater than String::kMaxLength.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>$ cat json-check-fail.js<span class="line"><!---->$ cat json-check-fail.js<!----></span><br>JSON.stringify(['a'.repeat(%StringMaxLength() - 1)])<span class="line"><!---->JSON.stringify(['a'.repeat(%StringMaxLength() - 1)])<!----></span><br>$ out/x64.release/d8 --allow-natives-syntax json-check-fail.js<span class="line"><!---->$ out/x64.release/d8 --allow-natives-syntax         > currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<span class="line"><!---->&gt; currently used NewStringFromAsciiChecked call NewStringFromOneByte directly<!----></span><br><br>The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal<String> when the length exceeds the max string length.<span class="line"><!---->The CHECK which is failing is the ToHandleChecked() in NewStringFromAsciiChecked. NewStringFromOneByte will already return an empty MaybeLocal&lt;String&gt; when the length exceeds the max string length.<!----></span><br><br>As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<span class="line"><!---->As an added benefit I think you'll find NewStringFromOneByte is faster since you already know the length, you can avoid the strlen call in base::OneByteVector(str).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
